titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1180, WORKING FAMILIES FLEXIBILITY ACT OF 2017; PROVIDING FOR PROCEEDINGS DURING THE PERIOD FROM MAY 5, 2017, THROUGH MAY 15, 2017; AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1180, WORKING FAMILIES FLEXIBILITY ACT OF 2017; PROVIDING FOR PROCEEDINGS DURING THE PERIOD FROM MAY 5, 2017, THROUGH MAY 15, 2017; AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 75

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 1180, to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to provide compensatory time for employees in the private sector, by a recorded vote of 229 ayes to 197 noes, Roll No. 244.<P/>Rejected the Scott (VA) motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Education and the Workforce with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 192 yeas to 234 nays, Roll No. 243.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-15 shall be considered as adopted, in lieu of the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Education and the Workforce now printed in the bill.<P/>H. Res. 299, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1180) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 231 ayes to 193 noes, Roll No. 241, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 190 nays, Roll No. 240.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 1180, to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to provide compensatory time for employees in the private sector, by a recorded vote of 229 ayes to 197 noes, Roll No. 244.<P/>Rejected the Scott (VA) motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Education and the Workforce with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 192 yeas to 234 nays, Roll No. 243.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-15 shall be considered as adopted, in lieu of the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Education and the Workforce now printed in the bill.<P/>H. Res. 299, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1180) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 231 ayes to 193 noes, Roll No. 241, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 190 nays, Roll No. 240.

extension.searchTitle: FEMA ACCOUNTABILITY, MODERNIZATION AND TRANSPARENCY ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 75

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Federal Emergency Management Agency Accountability, Modernization and Transparency Act of 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measure:<P/>H.R. 1679, to ensure that the Federal Emergency Management Agency's current efforts to modernize its grant management system includes applicant accessibility and transparency, by a 2/3 yea-and-nay vote of 419 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 242.

extension.searchTitle: WORKING FAMILIES FLEXIBILITY ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 75

congVote.result: So the motion to recommit was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 1180, to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to provide compensatory time for employees in the private sector, by a recorded vote of 229 ayes to 197 noes, Roll No. 244.<P/>Rejected the Scott (VA) motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Education and the Workforce with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 192 yeas to 234 nays, Roll No. 243.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-15 shall be considered as adopted, in lieu of the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Education and the Workforce now printed in the bill.
The House passed H.R. 1180, to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to provide compensatory time for employees in the private sector, by a recorded vote of 229 ayes to 197 noes, Roll No. 244.

The House passed H.R. 1180, to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to provide compensatory time for employees in the private sector, by a recorded vote of 229 ayes to 197 noes, Roll No. 244.<P/>Rejected the Scott (VA) motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Education and the Workforce with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 192 yeas to 234 nays, Roll No. 243.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-15 shall be considered as adopted, in lieu of the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Education and the Workforce now printed in the bill.
